EEO laws and DEI work in tandem. EEO laws are laws against discrimination in hiring, but they don’t provide solutions for thinks like implicit bias in resume review. Multiple studies have continued to show that recruiters, when reviewing resumes, at 50% more likely to contact a resume with a “white sounding name” over a “black sounding name” even when the qualifications are identical. Most people aren’t consciously making those choices; it’s implicit bias.
